entity

Class Message

  • entity.Message
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bean, KeyableBean

    public class Message
implements Bean, KeyableBean
    Active messages generated by events.

    • Field Summary

      Custom field that may be defined when acknowledging. This field is deprecated, please define a new custom extension field instead.

      Number of acks received.
      boolean Active
      this will test whether the message is active
      Date AfterSendTime
      Time of completion of afterSend method.
      Date BeforeSendLockTime
      Time of attempting to get lock before the call to beforeSend transformations.

      Time of completion of beforeSend transformations.

      Time of creating the message.

      Identifies the destination to send this message to.

      Number of duplicate errors received. This field is obsolete, it is not applicable to active messages.

      Get the names used when associating entities with the message. See {@link #putEntityByName}

      Type of error if the message is in error.
      String ErrorDescription
      Detailed description of error condition (set in the destination).

      Name of the event.

      Key of event root/cause, encoded as type:id.

      A CSV representation of the key->object ID map.

      Get the message root of this message. The default message root is the event root unless changed by setMessageRoot()

      Key of template root object/SOO, encoded as type:id.

      Custom field that may be set at message creation time. This field is deprecated, please define a new custom extension field instead.

      Contents of the message.
      KeyableBean PrimaryObject
      Returns the primary entity associated with this message
      Key PrimaryObjectKey
      Returns the key of the primary object associated with this message
      String PublicID
      ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped
      Date QueryTime
      Time of of query selecting message to be processed.
      Integer RetryCount
      Number of times message has been retried.
      Date RetryTime
      Time in the future at which to retry the message in error, applicable only to retryable error messages.
      boolean Retryable
      this will test whether the message is retryable
      Date SendLockTime
      Time of attempting to lock before the sending the message.
      Date SendLockedTime
      Time of after acquired lock lock before the sending the message.
      Integer SendOrder
      Order in which to send messages.
      Date SendTime
      Time of completion of sending the message.
      String SenderRefID
      Optional sender reference set at message send time.
      Integer Status
      Message status: 1-Pending send; 2-Pending ack; 3-Error; 4-Retryable error
      User User
      The user who created this message.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      KeyableBean copy()
      Makes a copy of the current bean. This method will also deep copy all owned arrays in this object graph.
      KeyableBean copy(block(field:IEntityPropertyInfo):Boolean shouldCopy)
      Makes a copy of the current bean. This method will also deep copy all properties where shouldCopy() returns true. For example, the above copy method simply calls this method with the block: \ field ->field typeis IArrayPropertyInfo && field.Owned
      Collection<T> getAddedArrayElements(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,Object[]> ref)
      Delegates to getAddedArrayElements(IArrayPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      Collection<T> getChangedArrayElements(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,Object[]> ref)
      Delegates to getChangedArrayElements(IArrayPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      KeyableBean getEntityByName(String name)
      Looks up and returns the entity stored on the message at the time that the message was created under the supplied name.
      T getOriginalValue(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,T> ref)
      Delegates to getOriginalValue(IEntityPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      Collection<T> getRemovedArrayElements(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,Object[]> ref)
      Delegates to getRemovedArrayElements(IArrayPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      boolean isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,Object[]> ref)
      Delegates to isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved(IArrayPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      boolean isArrayElementChanged(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,Object[]> ref)
      Delegates to isArrayElementChanged(IArrayPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      boolean isFieldChanged(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,Object> ref)
      Delegates to isFieldChanged(IEntityPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      void putEntityByName(String name, KeyableBean entity)
      Associates the supplied entity with the message under the name supplied as the name parameter. The object can be retrieved later using {@link #getEntityByName}
      void reportAck()
      Acknowledges receipt of the message by the remote system. Sets the status of message to ACKED and increments the ack count. If the message is not in pending ack, pending send, or pending retry states, increments the ack count and throws IllegalStateException. Note that a message may be acked in pending send or pending retry states if the ack is made during the send call before the message status is set to pending ack.
      void reportDuplicate()
      This method is obsolete and does nothing.
      void reportError()
      Report that the remote system ran into an error when processing the message. Sets the status of message to RETRYABLE_ERROR and increments the ack count. If the message is not in pending ack, pending send, or pending retry states, increments the ack count and throws IllegalStateException.
      void reportError(ErrorCategory category)
      Report that the remote system ran into an error when processing the message. Sets the status of message to RETRYABLE_ERROR and increments the ack count. Sets the error category to the specified category. If the message is not in pending ack, pending send, or pending retry states, increments the ack count and throws IllegalStateException.
      void reportError(Date retryTime)
      This behaves the same as reportError(), except that it schedules a retry of the message at the specified time. If retryTime is null it is equivalent to calling reportError(). If the retryTime is later than the current time, it schedules a retry at that time. If the retryTime is less than or equal to the currentTime, it throws an IllegalArgumentException.
      void reportNonRetryableError()
      Report that the remote system ran into an error when processing the message, and attempting a retry would not be appropriate. Sets the status of message to ERROR and increments the ack count. If the message is not in pending ack, pending send, or pending retry states, increments the ack count and throws IllegalStateException. Note that a message may be acked in pending send or pending retry states if the ack is made during the send call before the message status is set to pending ack. This method is obsolete. Instead, use error category to identify those messages that cannot be retried.
      Message retry()
      Retries the message. Depending on the status of the message being retried, this can behave in two ways. If the message has already been acked with an error, the retry mints a new message with a new id (since most recieving systems would otherwise reject the retried message as a duplicate). If the message has not yet been acked (presumably lost in flight), the original message is just resent. If the message is in any other state, throws IllegalStateException.
      void setMessageRoot(KeyableBean root)
      Set the message root of this message. If this method is not called, the default message root is just the event root. Use this method to change the message root to another object.
      void skip()
      Skips the message. Sets status to ERROR_CLEARED if message status is an error status Otherwise, sets messages status to SKIPPED if the message is in pending send or pending retry or pending ack state. If the message is in an inactive state (ie acked, error cleared, retried), throws IllegalStateException.

      • Methods inherited from class entity.KeyableBean

        void skip()
        Skips the message. Sets status to ERROR_CLEARED if message status is an error status Otherwise, sets messages status to SKIPPED if the message is in pending send or pending retry or pending ack state. If the message is in an inactive state (ie acked, error cleared, retried), throws IllegalStateException.

Sets the error category to the specified category. If the message is not in pending ack, pending send, or pending retry states, increments the ack count and throws IllegalStateException.

      • reportError

        void reportError(Date retryTime)
        This behaves the same as reportError(), except that it schedules a retry of the message at the specified time. If retryTime is null it is equivalent to calling reportError(). If the retryTime is later than the current time, it schedules a retry at that time. If the retryTime is less than or equal to the currentTime, it throws an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        retryTime - the time later than now to retry the message.

      • reportAck

        void reportAck()
        Acknowledges receipt of the message by the remote system. Sets the status of message to ACKED and increments the ack count. If the message is not in pending ack, pending send, or pending retry states, increments the ack count and throws IllegalStateException. Note that a message may be acked in pending send or pending retry states if the ack is made during the send call before the message status is set to pending ack.

      • retry

        Message retry()
        Retries the message. Depending on the status of the message being retried, this can behave in two ways. If the message has already been acked with an error, the retry mints a new message with a new id (since most recieving systems would otherwise reject the retried message as a duplicate). If the message has not yet been acked (presumably lost in flight), the original message is just resent. If the message is in any other state, throws IllegalStateException.
        Returns:
        The message that will be sent, either a new message or the existing message as appropriate

        Set the message root of this message. If this method is not called, the default message root is just the event root. Use this method to change the message root to another object.

                   KeyableBean entity)
        Associates the supplied entity with the message under the name supplied as the name parameter. The object can be retrieved later using {@link #getEntityByName}
        Parameters:
        name - The name to be used when storing the reference to the entity
        entity - An entity to be associated with the message

      • reportDuplicate

        void reportDuplicate()
        This method is obsolete and does nothing.

      • reportNonRetryableError

        void reportNonRetryableError()
        Report that the remote system ran into an error when processing the message, and attempting a retry would not be appropriate. Sets the status of message to ERROR and increments the ack count. If the message is not in pending ack, pending send, or pending retry states, increments the ack count and throws IllegalStateException. Note that a message may be acked in pending send or pending retry states if the ack is made during the send call before the message status is set to pending ack. This method is obsolete. Instead, use error category to identify those messages that cannot be retried.
